intro: Draba norvegica var. laxa, commonly known as the loose draba, is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial plant native to northern Europe. It typically reaches heights of 5–15 cm and features basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in early spring, often before the leaves fully emerge. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. This variety is characterized by its lax, open growth habit and is part of the Brassicaceae family.
